title: Your Face Your Fate
brief: Evaluate your fate through face reading with computer vision
detail:
Your Face Your Fate is a project to recognize face features through photos.
The concept of this project is from traditional Chinese fortune telling. It can predict the fortune and future of a person by the shape of his face, eyes, nose, mouth etc.

title: Congestion
brief: Pass through waves of crowd and find the exit
detail:
Exploratory project on Unity's Navigation Mesh.
The player need to pass though waves of ai, collect enough key to open the exit door.

title: Red Cam Green Cam
brief: Play Red Light, Green Light with a camera bot
detail:
Motion-based game in light of the famous classic game Red Light, Green Light. The goal is to push the button next to the camera bot, without getting noticed by it.
 The magic behind is a python program which analysis the motion inside the camera view and response to it.

title: Dashgon
detail: This project aim to understand the fudamental of 2d game development, by implementing scenes, entity, collision system through strict object-oriented design.

title: Pong-Q
brief: AI learn to play pong with Q-learning
detail: A weekend project, implements machine learning for Pong AI in Python. By using Q-learning method, the machine learning AI learns how to beat a traditional AI.

title: Duel!
brief: Experience the duel of cowboys using Kinect
detail: University assignment of 3d natural interaction, a kinect game which simulate the duel of cowboys.

You, No.4386 are a death row and you only have five days left. Find Keys to unlock exit while hide from the guards.
This is a game AI course assignment, I implemented a FSM with Unity's animator API.

title: Seymour
brief: Seymour the dog is looking for someone...
detail: A maze game made during GGJ2017. The topic is 'waves', so we figure out to use waves to detect the maze structure.

title: Backward Beginning
detail:
A story based puzzle game which has a gameplay similar to the traditional transport puzzle Sokoban.
This project features a node-based navigation system. This system could be divided into modules and componenets so the game designer could build levels and create character without knowing the code underneath.
